channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: This Is the End of China’s Once Mightiest Property Firm
item.description: China Evergrande, set to be delisted from the Hong Kong Stock Exchange on Monday, leaves behind a giant pile of debt and a long line of desperate cred...

item.title: Russia’s Top Diplomat Says There Is No Plan for Putin-Zelensky Meeting
item.description: The statement by Foreign Minister Sergey V. Lavrov deals a blow to President Trump’s efforts to mediate an end to the war in Ukraine.

item.title: SpaceX Scrubs Critical 10th Test Launch of Starship Rocket
item.description: Elon Musk’s company will reschedule the next trip of its Starship prototype, which faced setbacks in its last three flight attempts.

item.title: National Guard Patrols Begin to Carry Weapons in D.C.
item.description: More than 2,200 troops were deployed in Washington as of Sunday, a Guard spokesman said.

item.title: Hong Kong Denies Visa Renewal for Senior Bloomberg Journalist
item.description: The unexplained decision raises new concerns about the erosion of press freedom in a city transformed by Beijing’s national security law.

item.title: After Trump’s Threat to Send National Guard to Chicago, Democrats Push Back
item.description: President Trump said he was considering sending troops to Chicago, New York and Baltimore. State and local leaders say they have crime under control.

item.title: Millions in West facing dangerous heatwave amid multiple wildfires
item.description: Parts of California, Oregon and Washington state will experience extreme heat at least through Tuesday, forecasters said.

item.title: SpaceX postpones 10th test launch of massive Starship rocket
item.description: SpaceX wants to put the two-stage rocket's massive booster through its paces. On Sunday, it postponed the launch "to troubleshoot an issue with ground...

item.title: It was the costliest hurricane in U.S. history: Have we forgotten Katrina's lessons?
item.description: Nearly 1,400 people died after Hurricane Katrina crashed into Louisiana and Mississippi. Most of the deaths were in New Orleans, which has had an unev...

item.title: Illinois officials blast Trump's threat to deploy National Guard in Chicago
item.description: Earlier in August, Trump deployed hundreds of National Guard members to Washington, D.C., as part of what he touted as an effort to reduce crime and r...

item.title: Kilmar Abrego Garcia expects to be detained by ICE again, attorney says
item.description: The lawyer for Kilmar Abrego Garcia, the man wrongly deported by the Trump administration to an El Salvadoran prison and then returned months later, s...

item.title: Revealing Taste
item.description: A clever leak exposed the music habits of some famous people — and two Times journalists.

item.title: Monday Briefing: Would Ukraine Give Up the Donbas?
item.description: Also, the U.S. Open gets going.

item.title: Singer Marko Perkovic’s Fascist-Era Salute Evokes a Bloody Time in Croatia
item.description: There’s a new generation of fans for the singer known as Thompson, who uses the salute and nationalist rhetoric to cast himself as a guardian of Croat...

item.title: As Other Israelis Die in War, Ultra-Orthodox Resist Call to Fight
item.description: Ultra-Orthodox Israelis, exempt for decades from military service, are now being drafted. Their rage is dividing Israel and threatening Prime Minister...
